alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 28 at 6:05PM PDT until October 29 at 1:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PDT SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 expected. For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Lake County. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM PDT Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, until 1 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Provide adequate shelter for outdoor pets or consider bringing them indoors. Frost Advisories and Freeze Warnings are issued during the local growing season as defined by climatology and local agriculture experts. Once the growing season has ended these statements will no longer be issued until the spring.
